basics.name: Ana M. Palacio Castro
basics.label: Assistant Scientist
basics.summary: Biologist interested how ocean warming, acidification, diseases, and pollution affect corals. I identify environmental and genetic factors that promote more resistant corals that could survive in our fast changing world.

education.thesis: Dissertation: Abiotic controls on endosymbiotic algal communities and their implications for coral bleaching susceptibility and recovery.
Thesis: Comparison of methods for monitoring sessile benthic communities in “La Azufrada”, coral reef, Gorgona Island National Natural Park.

work.name: UM-CIMAS, NOAA-AOML
work.summary: Conducted research and successfully acquired funding. Oversaw laboratory and field-based research projects. Authored publications in peer-reviewed journals and presented research at conferences. Acted as Co-Principal Investigator (Co-PI) and Principal Investigator (PI) on grants totaling over four million dollars. Disseminated research findings through various popular media channels. Supervised two undergraduate students and participated on a Master’s student committee.

work.name: UM-CIMAS, NOAA-AOML
work.summary: Conducted research and successfully acquired funding. Led laboratory research projects. Authored publications in peer-reviewed journals and presented at internaional conferences. Acted as Co-Principal Investigator (Co-PI) and Principal Investigator (PI) on grants. Disseminated research findings through various popular media channels. Participated on a Master’s student committee.

awards.title: PI: High-replication assessment of the effects of poor water quality on South Florida coral health and susceptibility to Stony Coral Tissue Loss Disease
PI: Assessing the effects of environmental co-factors on SCTLD transmission and progression rates
